gabarito.plumbing.ConsoleReporter.name: gabarito.plumbing.ConsoleReporter
gabarito.plumbing.ConsoleReporter.description:
The console reporter prints the gabarito events to the node's console
with colors and what-not.

gabarito.plumbing.Environment.name: gabarito.plumbing.Environment
gabarito.plumbing.Environment.description:
The environment is responsible for loading the gabarito, the test files and
running the tests themselves.

It must implement the method getName in order to describe itself to the
reporters.

The dispatch method receives the files list, the reporters involved and a
callback function that should be called when things complete, passing the
results to the callback function as first argument.

gabarito.plumbing.JUnitXmlReporter.name: gabarito.plumbing.JUnitXmlReporter
gabarito.plumbing.JUnitXmlReporter.description:
The JUnitXmlReporter produces a XML file with the test results that has
the jUnit format. Useful to use along with your favorite CI solution.

params.name: file
params.description: The file to write the xml itself

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the jUnit report

gabarito.plumbing.NodeEnvironment.name: gabarito.plumbing.NodeEnvironment
gabarito.plumbing.NodeEnvironment.description:
The NodeEnvironment runs the tests under the node-js itself. It loades
the files using the require mechanism, but it deletes them from the
node's cache beforehand.

gabarito.plumbing.PhantomEnvironment.name: gabarito.plumbing.PhantomEnvironment
gabarito.plumbing.PhantomEnvironment.description:
The PhantomEnvironment uses the phantomjs to navigate to
"http://localhost:1432" in order to run the tests.

gabarito.plumbing.Reporter.name: gabarito.plumbing.Reporter
gabarito.plumbing.Reporter.description:
The reporter class that describes all the events issued by the environment
while running the tests.

A reporter may implement any method described here, the default
implementation does nothing.

gabarito.plumbing.Runner.name: gabarito.plumbing.Runner
gabarito.plumbing.Runner.description:
The gabarito runner. It needs the reporters in order to receive the
varius events issued by the environments. The environments in which the
test should run, and the files containing the tests themselves.

gabarito.plumbing.ServerEnvironment.name: gabarito.plumbing.ServerEnvironment
gabarito.plumbing.ServerEnvironment.description:
The server environment provides a simple http server to serve the test
files and run the tests themselves within a browser.

An implementation must implement a way of dispatching a browser to
navigate to "http://localhost:1432" and it may implement a method to
close the browser when the gabarito has finished.

gabarito.Assert.name: gabarito.Assert
gabarito.Assert.description: Static class that contains various assertions

gabarito.AssertThat.name: gabarito.AssertThat
gabarito.AssertThat.description:
A nice helper to use asserts in a more expressive way. It has all
the methods from the {{#crossLink "gabarito.Assert"}}{{/crossLink}}.

gabarito.TestBuilder.name: gabarito.TestBuilder

gabarito.Matcher.name: gabarito.Matcher
gabarito.Matcher.description:
The matcher consists of a single function that evaluates whether a
given values meets the matcher function criteria.

gabarito.VarargsMatcher.name: gabarito.VarargsMatcher
gabarito.VarargsMatcher.description:
The varargs matcher uses a single function that will receive an array
containing all the remaining args passed to the function while applying
the matchers.

This matcher should always be the last matcher.

gabarito.SpyVerifier.name: gabarito.SpyVerifier
gabarito.SpyVerifier.description:
The verifier is used to check for the arguments, return or error
thrown.

gabarito.Spy.name: gabarito.Spy
gabarito.Spy.description:
The spy relays the calls to the actual function, but records every
call, along with its parameters, its return or error if thrown.

To verify a given call, the {#crossLink
"gabarito.SpyVerifier"}}{{/crossLink}} may be obtained through the
verify method.

gabarito.Context.name: gabarito.Context
gabarito.Context.description:
The context class is passed to each clause when it is run, also to
the before and after functions.

It provides means to run tests asynchronously through the
{{#crossLink "gabarito.Context#stay"}}{{/crossLink}},
{{#crossLink "gabarito.Context#go"}}{{/crossLink}} and
{{#crossLink "gabarito.Context#going"}}{{/crossLink}} methods.

gabarito.ClauseResult.name: gabarito.ClauseResult
gabarito.ClauseResult.description: Dummy class that describes the clause result data structure

gabarito.EnvironmentResult.name: gabarito.EnvironmentResult
gabarito.EnvironmentResult.description: Dummy class that describes the environment results data structure

gabarito.TestResult.name: gabarito.TestResult
gabarito.TestResult.description: Dummy class that describes the test results data structure

classitems.description: Prints a row saying that things are starting.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description:
Prints a small summary when things have finished showing the test
results.
classitems.name: finish

classitems.description: Prints a row stating that that n tests will be verified.

Prints a message stating that the environment issued an error and
prints the error itself in red.

The function that will be called when things

classitems.description:
This method may be implemented in order to clean up any browser
reference.

It must call the done function afterwards.
classitems.name: ditchBrowser

classitems.description:
This method must be implemented in order to dispatch the browser to
navigate to "http://localhost:1432".

The done function must be called afterwards.
classitems.name: dispatchBrowser

classitems.description:
Adds a clause within the test object.

If the clause body is omitted, an unimplemented clause that
always throws an error will be used instead.
classitems.name: clause

classitems.description: Sets the before function within the test object.
classitems.name: before

classitems.description: Sets the after function within the test object.
classitems.name: after

classitems.description: Sets test name for the test object.
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
The mather method should evaluate the matcher function and
tell whether the value matches the criteria.
classitems.name: matches

classitems.description:
Returns the Error instance with the formatted message using the
argument's position and the argument itself.
classitems.name: error

classitems.description: Matcher for string type
classitems.name: matcher.STRING

classitems.description: Matcher for array type
classitems.name: matcher.ARRAY

classitems.description: Matcher for function type

classitems.description: Matcher for object type
classitems.name: matcher.OBJECT

classitems.description: Matcher for array type
classitems.name: matcher.NUMBER

classitems.description:
Literal value matcher

If given value is an object (not a function) or an array, it uses
parts.equals, otherwise it will check for it's identity
classitems.name: matcher.value

classitems.description:
Returns a matcher that always passes. This matcher stores the value
passed to the matcher for further inspection later on.
classitems.name: matcher.grabber

classitems.description:
Just like the grabber matcher, this matcher that always passes. It
stores the value passed to the matcher for further inspection
later on.

It works as a varargs matcher.
classitems.name: mather.argsGrabber

classitems.description: Checks if the calls arguments matches with the given matchers
classitems.name: args

classitems.description: Asserts that this call was made before another call
classitems.name: before

classitems.description: Asserts that this call was made after another call
classitems.name: after

classitems.description:
Checks what has been throw by the call using the matcher o a
value matcher.
classitems.name: withThis

classitems.description:
Checks what has been throw by the call using the matcher o a
value matcher.
classitems.name: throwing

classitems.description:
Checks what has been returmed by the call using the matcher o a
value matcher.
classitems.name: returning

classitems.description:
The handler function that relays all the calls, this is the
actual function that should be used instead of the real one.
classitems.name: handler

classitems.description: Relays the verify call to the spy instance.
classitems.name: handler.verify

classitems.description: Relays the noCalls call to the spy instance.
classitems.name: handler.noCalls

classitems.description: Relays the reset call to the spy instance.
classitems.name: handler.reset

classitems.description: Creates a spy instance and returns its handler
classitems.name: on

return.description:
Returns the handler function from the spy
        instance

classitems.description: Returns a spy verifier if a call was made
classitems.name: verify

classitems.description: Throws an error if a call was made
classitems.name: noCalls

classitems.description: Removes all recorded calls from the instance
classitems.name: reset

classitems.description: Tells the context to wait for an async continuation.
classitems.name: stay

classitems.description: Tells the context to resume
classitems.name: go

classitems.description:
Returns a function that when called, tells the context to
resume the current clause and also passes the parameters
along to the given function.

Just a syntatic sugar to avoid another nesting level.
classitems.name: going

classitems.description:
Adds a test using the
{{#crossLink "gabarito.TestBuilder"}}{{/crossLink}} within
gabarito.
classitems.name: test

classitems.description:
Resets the gabarito to it's initial state, removing all listeners
as well.
classitems.name: reset

classitems.description:
Tells gabarito that the preparations will be async.

This method returns a function that should be called when all
tests are ready.

Adds a test within the gabarito.

The sketch is an object containing various methods. Each method
is treated as a draft. Every draft is run to check if it works.
classitems.name: sketch

classitems.description:
Register an event listener for a given event.

Available events:

- init: The initialization of the gabarito verification.
- begin: The beginning of a test verification.
- enter: When gabarito is about to enter into a clause
verification.
- pass: Whenever a clause passes.
- fail: Whenever a clause fails.
- end: When a test verification has ended.
- complete: When all the test verifications have completed.
- say: Custom event to emit whatever message.
classitems.name: on

classitems.description: Removes an event listener for a given event.
Verify all tests
classitems.name: verify

classitems.description: Tells gabarito to say something.
classitems.name: say

classitems.description: Reference containing the various assert utils.
classitems.name: assert

classitems.description:
Creates an instance of
{{#crossLink "gabarito.Spy"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: spy

classitems.description:
Creates a custom matcher using the function as a matching
criteria.

The function will receive a value to examinate and should return
a boolean indicating whether the criteria is met.
classitems.name: matcher

classitems.description: The timestamp that the clause has started
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: The number of miliseconds that the clause took to run
classitems.name: elapsedTime

classitems.description: The thrown error (if any) by the test clause
classitems.name: error

classitems.description: The related environment that has run the tests
classitems.name: environment

classitems.description: A collection of test results for the given environment
classitems.name: results

classitems.description: The test name
classitems.name: test

classitems.description: The timestamp that the test has started
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: The timestamp that the test has ended
classitems.name: end

classitems.description:
Dictionary in which the key are the related clause and the value is a
{{#crossLink "gabarito.ClauseResult"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: results

This method returns a function that should be called when all
